marketNews.title: MSCI Withdraws Exemption for BREN, CUAN, and PTRO
marketNews.content: MSCI on Friday (11/7) announced that Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN), Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN), and Petrosea ($PTRO) will no longer be subject to exceptional treatment and will be evaluated according to the applicable methodology (including its changes) for the August 2025 index review and thereafter. This decision follows the cancellation of the plan to implement the 'unusual market activity (UMA) and/or Special Monitoring Board (FCA) related to criterion 10' mechanism over the last 12 months as an MSCI review criterion. The plan was cancelled after MSCI received input from market participants, who considered the mechanism too strict. Market participants also provided input that the application of regulations related to the special monitoring board should be consistent with other stock markets, such as the Taiwan stock market. Instead, MSCI announced that stocks listed on the Special Monitoring Board (FCA) related to criterion 10 in the last ~4 months - namely, from the previous index review price cutoff until 3 working days before the nearest index review effective date - will not be included in the index and/or migrated between Standard and Small Cap. Key Takeaway: Based on our understanding, here are some scenarios related to UMA, suspension, FCA, and their connection to the MSCI review: 1. UMA 1st time: will still be reviewed and potentially included in the index. 2. UMA 2nd time resulting in a 1-day suspension: will still be reviewed and potentially included in the index. 3. Suspension for more than 1 day resulting in listing on the Special Monitoring Board (FCA): will not be reviewed and must wait for the next review period.

marketNews.title: Minister of Finance Releases E-commerce SME Tax Collection Regulation
marketNews.content: The Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, on Monday (14/7) officially released Finance Ministerial Regulation No. 37/2025 which requires e-commerce platforms to collect and impose income tax on sales made by small and medium-scale sellers. The regulation requires platforms meeting certain criteria to withhold and impose a tax of 0.5% on sales made by sellers with annual turnover between 500 million and 4.8 billion rupiah. Although this regulation is effective starting July 14, 2025, e-commerce platforms will be given 1 month to comply with this rule.

marketNews.title: China's June Coal Imports Sink as Domestic Production Rises
marketNews.content: China's customs administration recorded that China's coal imports in June 2025 dropped to 33.04 million tonnes (-26% YoY, -8% MoM), marking the lowest monthly import since February 2023. This result caused China's coal imports during 1H25 to drop -11% YoY to 221.7 million tonnes. Reuters reported that the decline in China's coal imports occurred concurrently with an increase in domestic production to replace low-quality coal imports. During 5M25, China's coal production increased +6% YoY. The Vice President of the China Coal Transportation and Distribution Association, Li Xuegang, stated in June 2025 that China's coal imports could drop by about 50-100 million tonnes throughout 2025, equivalent to a decrease of up to -18% YoY.

marketNews.title: EU and Indonesia Reach Political Agreement on Free Trade Deal
marketNews.content: The President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, said on Sunday (13/7) that the European Union and Indonesia have succeeded in reaching a political agreement on the free trade agreement between the two parties. Von der Leyen stated that the trade agreement - referred to as the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) - will create more opportunities in key sectors, such as agriculture and automotive. The Minister of Investment, Rosan Roeslani, mentioned that the agreement, which has been negotiated for 10 years, will be signed in September 2025. Rosan also claimed that once the agreement is implemented, the value of Indonesian trade to the European Union could increase from the current level of 30 billion US dollars per year to 60 billion US dollars.

marketNews.title: Italy States EU Prepares 21 Billion Euro Tariffs Against US Imports
marketNews.content: The Minister of Foreign Affairs of Italy, Antonio Tajani, said on Monday (14/7) that the European Union has prepared a list of tariffs worth 21 billion euros for goods imported from the US if the two parties fail to reach a trade agreement. Tajani added that the European Union could also prepare a follow-up tariff package if an agreement with the US proves impossible to realize. Nevertheless, Tajani stated that he is confident that progress can be achieved in negotiations between the two parties. Tajani's statement came after US President Donald Trump said on Saturday (12/7) that he would impose a 30% tariff on most imports from the European Union and Mexico starting August 1, 2025, adding to similar warnings for other countries and leaving them less than three weeks to hammer out framework deals that could lower the threatened tariff rate.

marketNews.title: US National Economic Council Director Discusses Authority to Dismiss Fed Chair Jerome Powell
marketNews.content: The Director of the US National Economic Council, Kevin Hassett, said on Sunday (13/7) that the administration of President Donald Trump is reviewing whether it has the authority to dismiss The Fed Chairman, Jerome Powell. Hassett added that Trump has that authority if there is strong cause to dismiss Powell. Trump himself said that he does not want to fire Powell, but Hassett's comments indicate that the Trump administration is still considering that possibility.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Motor Vehicle Production Decreases Amidst Weak Purchasing Power
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Automotive Industry Association (Gaikindo) noted that the total national car production during 1H25 fell -1.7% YoY to 552,509 units. This decline occurred along with the slump in national car wholesales by -9% YoY during 1H25. The Chairman I of Gaikindo, Jongkie Sugiarto, stated that the sales decline was pressured by weakening public purchasing power.

marketNews.title: Cement Industry Sales Volume Drops in June, INTP Market Share Slightly Increases
marketNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa management noted that the volume of cement industry sales in Indonesia dropped to 4.9 million tonnes in June 2025 (-7.3% YoY, -5.6% MoM), coinciding with holidays, high rainfall, and an economic situation that has not yet improved. This result caused the volume of cement industry sales in Indonesia during 1H25 to drop -3.1% YoY (vs. 1H24: +2.2% YoY), with weakening occurring both on Java Island (-2.9% YoY) and outside Java Island (-3.2% YoY). In terms of segmentation, the volume of bag cement sales was flat year-on-year during 1H25, with sales contribution increasing to 72% (vs. 1H24: 69.8%). On the other hand, the volume of bulk cement sales fell -10% YoY, with its contribution to total sales also decreasing to 28% (vs. 1H24: 30.2%).

marketNews.title: "Eventually the company will return to the same problems as before."
marketNews.content: Quote from parahitairawan: Eventually the company will return to the same problems as before.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri Plans Board Changes at August 2025 EGM
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) plans to change the company's management, which will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on August 4, 2025. Previously, the plan for the RUPSLB was announced on June 30, 2025. Kontan reported that the President Director, Darmawan Junaidi, is rumored to be replaced at the RUPSLB, although the successor is not yet known.

tickerNews.title: Summarecon Agung's Marketing Sales Reached IDR 1.3 Trillion in 2Q25
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung ($SMRA) recorded marketing sales of 1.3 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+42% YoY, +48% QoQ). This result brought cumulative marketing sales for 1H25 to 2.2 trillion rupiah (+26% YoY), equivalent to 43% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah. The housing segment contributed 70% of marketing sales during 1H25, followed by shophouses (27%), apartments (2.5%), land plots (0.4%), and offices and commercial properties (0.1%).

tickerNews.title: Ciputra Development's Marketing Sales Reached IDR 4.2 Trillion in 1H25
tickerNews.content: The Director of Ciputra Development ($CTRA), Harun Hajadi, stated to Kontan that the company recorded marketing sales of 4.2 trillion rupiah during 1H25 (-31% YoY), equivalent to approximately 38% of the 2025 target of 11 trillion rupiah. This result indicates that CTRA's marketing sales realization in 2Q25 was around 1 trillion rupiah (-62% YoY, -67% QoQ). Harun said that customers currently need more time to decide whether or not to buy property, indicating a market slowdown this year.

tickerNews.title: PT Bara Makmur Abadi Sells ~109.1 Million TOBA Shares, Reducing Stake
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama shareholder, PT Bara Makmur Abadi, sold approximately 109.1 million TOBA ($TOBA) shares at an average price of 835 rupiah per share between June 12 and July 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 91.1 billion rupiah, where this transaction was intended for the transfer of rights over the shares. After this transaction, PT Bara Makmur Abadi's ownership in TOBA decreased from approximately 5.47% to approximately 4.14%.

tickerNews.title: PT PP Secures New Contracts Worth IDR 9.37 Trillion in 1H25
tickerNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of PT PP ($PTPP), Joko Raharjo, informed Kontan that the company recorded a new contract value of 9.37 trillion rupiah during 1H25 (-1.4% YoY), equivalent to 32.87% of the 2025 target of 28.5 trillion rupiah. This new contract value was dominated by projects from State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) at 46.29%, followed by private sector at 31.73%, and government at 21.98%.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Down 6.2% YoY in June 2025, Market Share Slightly Rises
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa ($INTP) recorded a decline in cement sales volume of -6.2% YoY in June 2025, leading to a total sales volume drop of -2.8% YoY during 1H25 (vs. 1H24: +10% YoY). Despite this, market share during 1H25 slightly increased to 29.5% from last year's position (vs. 1H24: 29.4%, 1Q25: 30.1%). In terms of segmentation, bag cement sales in June 2025 dropped -5.1% YoY in Java Island, although outside Java Island it still grew +5.2% YoY. INTP management explained that the volume decline in Java was due to the company's maintained selling price, while several competitors began offering discounts or promotions in areas experiencing contraction. During 1H25, INTP's bag cement sales still grew slightly (+0.8% YoY), while bulk cement continued to decline (-11% YoY).
